column16: Cardamine hirsuta is a ANNUAL growing to 0.3 m (1ft).  See above for USDA hardiness. It is hardy to UK zone 5 and is not frost tender.  It is in flower from April to August, and the seeds ripen from May to September. The species is hermaphrodite (has both male and female organs). The plant is self-fertile.  Suitable for: light (sandy), medium (loamy) and heavy (clay) soils and can grow in nutritionally poor soil. Suitable pH: mildly acid, neutral and basic (mildly alkaline) soils. It can grow in  semi-shade (light woodland) or no shade. It prefers  moist soil.
